deal.features:
- Finally, some batteries from a real battery brand: [Eveready by Energizer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eveready_Battery_Company) (so kinda like *two* real battery brands)
- Just AAs this time, the Hardest-Working Battery in Show Business
- Eveready Gold batteries are appropriate for 50th anniversary gifts, first-place athletic awards, commemorating top-selling recordings, and paying tribute to Cortez
- Won't expire until long into the cyberpunk future world of 2024 AD
- Model: A91BP-36
deal.title: Eveready Gold AA Alkaline Batteries (72-Pack)
deal.specifications:
Specs 
====
- Model: A91BP-36
- Type: Alkaline
- Power: 1.5V
- Capacity: 2850 mAh
- Ten year life
- Manufactured Fall 2014
[We opened the boxes...](https://res.cloudinary.com/mediocre/image/upload/v1437508151/srbohrlxmvcghgm3wrju.jpg)
[...to make sure...](https://res.cloudinary.com/mediocre/image/upload/v1437508138/ljqskxqvlpbipdibu7ln.jpg)
[...that they weren't shitty](https://res.cloudinary.com/mediocre/image/upload/v1437508162/tkquc8k02ug7fey3hd0g.jpg)

**Condition:** New
**Warranty:** [1 Year Energizer](http://www.energizer.com/contact-us)
**Estimated Delivery:** 7/29 - 8/1
**Shipping:** $5 or free with **[VMP](https://mediocre.com/vmp)**

What's in the Box?
====
72x Eveready AA batteries

Pictures 
====
[Face](https://res.cloudinary.com/mediocre/image/upload/v1437489690/yctb0ueixzq92qzyd8sd.png)
[Packaging](https://res.cloudinary.com/mediocre/image/upload/v1437427281/jjupupv7h54tl61x5ndx.png)
[Batteries](https://res.cloudinary.com/mediocre/image/upload/v1437427257/iox5ddswfegjfqucykx4.png)

Price Comparison
====
[$23.04 (for 2 36-packs) at Amazon](http://www.amazon.com/dp/B001F0RCYG/?tag=meh0ec-20)

[This handy post](http://electronics.woot.com/forums/viewpost.aspx?postid=5829698&pageindex=1&replycount=10#post5829919) by silalus over at Woot gives some information per battery comparisons. 

For reference, ours break down to: 
$0.14 per battery if you're a VMP for 1, 2, or 3 pack

Not a VMP? 
$0.21 per battery with shipping for a 1 pack 
$0.17 per battery with shipping for a 2 pack 
$0.16 per battery with shipping for a 3 pack 

*Find a relevant price comparison? Please share it in a comment in this thread :)*

story.title: Sometimes generic is fine. Sometimes not.
story.body:
Generic aspirin? Sure, it's the same active ingredient. Generic potato chips? For you, whatever, eat what you dig. If company's coming over, serve the name brand. Generic trash bags? It only takes one catastrophic rupture to make that 79 cents' savings seem like a rip-off. 

Well, we thought generics were in that they'll-be-more-or-less-fine category. But when we see over 300 comments on [a thread about a battery sale](https://meh.com/forum/topics/aa-or-aaa-alkaline-batteries-48-pack), we know either something very, very good has happened - or something very, very bad. The generics weren't fine.

Hey, let's not relive that all over again. Let's just have a moment's peace here with a battery brand we trust: Energizer. Oh, wait a minute: Eveready. No, no, hang on, it's Eveready *by* Energizer. So *two* brands we trust. And they throw "Gold" in there, the commodity most trusted by investors, cable TV news viewers, and leprechauns. So they're double-extra trusty. No reason for anyone to complain.

And that's what we really need right now. Just some peace and quiet. We still believe the perfect generic AA battery is out there somewhere. But today, we're spelling "DRAMA" without AA.

answers.text: Most of the time, if possible
Sometimes, for certain products I don't care about that much
Only if the generic and brand-name products are literally identical (e.g., pharmaceuticals)
Never - it's worth it to pay a little more for the good stuff
Some non-generic answer you'll post in the forum

poll.title: How often do you buy generic?
